column4: hey i am dual booting ubuntu10.04 and xp after updating the kernel xp got removed from boot menu,how to bring it back?
XP is not listed in GRUB on boot?
Yes its not listed, earlier it was there
cli sudo update-grub
ok i ran it
reboot and let me know if it's back
here is the output if it helps anyway http://paste.ubuntu.com/574324/
do you have Windows on one HDD and Ubuntu on the other?
no i have only 1 hdd its a laptop
alright. I had something similar happen to me... but unfortunately Windows was on another drive. I'm sorry but I'm lost.. perhaps someone with a bit more knowhow will pick up where I left off
ok thanks though
you will probably end up editing your /boot/grub/menu.lst to add windows and point grub to the partitiion
ok thanx
found several threads on a google search on how to complete the operation
ok will check
the drive in which windows is installed can not mount it
uh oh,
what version of ubuntu are you running?
it wont mount the partition its on?
it wont mount not in gui or in cli
thats random..... I'm sorry I'm lost there.
